hook.text: Getting 1% better each day means you're 37 times better after one year. Habits compound like interest.

buildup.text: Small improvements are invisible daily. Over months and years, they accumulate into massive transformation.

discovery.text: Conversely, 1% worse daily means you decline to nearly zero. Bad habits compound too â€” in the wrong direction.

twist.text: People overestimate what they can do in a week and underestimate what they can do in a year. Patience wins.

climax.text: The question isn't whether habits matter. It's whether you'll stay patient long enough to see the compound.

punchline.text: Habits compound. One percent daily changes everything.

quiz.question: How much better are you after one year of 1% daily improvement?
